citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC reviewed and approved Protocol #20034, which did not include a number, or justification for the number, of
hamsters requested for protocol activities. It is important for protocols to include a number needed for each species and a
justification for that number so that the IACUC can review it and determine if the number requested is appropriate for the
proposed work. Failure to provide and review these details can result in an excess of animals used and euthanized.
The registrant must ensure that all protocols contain not only a rationale for involving animals and the appropriateness of
the species used, but also the rationale for the numbers of each species to be used.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Attending Veterinarian and facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(e)(2)  Repeat
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The IACUC reviewed and approved Protocol #20034, which did not include a number, or justification for the number, of 
hamsters requested for protocol activities. It is important for protocols to include a number needed for each species and a 
justification for that number so that the IACUC can review it and determine if the number requested is appropriate for the 
proposed work. Failure to provide and review these details can result in an excess of animals used and euthanized. 
The registrant must ensure that all protocols contain not only a rationale for involving animals and the appropriateness of 
the species used, but also the rationale for the numbers of each species to be used. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Attending Veterinarian and facility representatives.
